declarations.comments: Matrix with height `h`, width `w` and contained value `a`
declarations.title: Matrix

declarations.comments:
## Creation
create Matrix of size hxw with a generator-function

```purescript
> fill (\x y -> x) :: Matrix D2 D3 Int
  [0,1,2]
  [0,1,2]
```
declarations.title: fill

declarations.comments:
```purescript
> fromVec (Vec.vec3 1 2 3) :: Matrix D1 D3 _
  [1,2,3]

> fromVec (Vec.vec3 1 2 3) :: Matrix D3 D1 _
  [1]
  [2]
  [3]
```
declarations.title: fromVec

declarations.comments:
Convert Matrix to Array

```purescript
> toArray (matrix22 1 2 3 4)
[[1,2],[3,4]]
```
declarations.title: toArray

declarations.comments:
## Basic Accesors
height of the matrix (aka number of rows)
declarations.title: height

declarations.comments: width of the matrix (aka number of columns)
declarations.title: width

declarations.comments: size of square matrix
declarations.title: size

declarations.comments:
value a position in matrix:

```purescript
> m
 [1,2,-3]
 [4,9,0]
 [11,2,8]
> index d0 d2 m -- d0, d2 are value-representations of D0 D2
11
```
declarations.title: index

declarations.comments:
value a position in matrix:

```purescript
> m
 [1,2,-3]
 [4,9,0]
 [11,2,8]
> index 0 2 m
Just 11
> index 10 2 m
Nothing
```
declarations.title: index'

declarations.comments:
get vector for column

```purescript
> m
  [1,2]
  [0,5]
> column m d1
[2,5]
```
declarations.title: column

declarations.comments:
get vector for row

```purescript
> m
  [1,2]
  [0,5]
> row m d1
[0,5]
```
declarations.title: row

declarations.comments:
```purescript
> matrix22 1 2 3 4 `concatH` matrix22 0 1 2 0
 [1,2,0,1]
 [3,4,2,0]
```
declarations.title: concatH

declarations.comments:
## Basic Operations

```purescript
> matrix22 1 2 3 4 `concatV` matrix22 0 1 2 0
 [1,2]
 [3,4]
 [0,1]
 [2,0]
```
declarations.title: concatV

declarations.comments:
Zip Matrices with function with **E**xactly the same size

```purescript
> zipWithE Tuple (matrix22 1 2 0 0) (matrix22 1 3 4 5)
 [(Tuple 1 1),(Tuple 2 3)]
 [(Tuple 0 4),(Tuple 0 5)]
```
declarations.title: zipWithE

declarations.comments:
Zip Matrices with **E**xactly the same size

```purescript
> zipE (matrix22 1 2 0 0) (matrix22 1 3 4 5)
 [(Tuple 1 1),(Tuple 2 3)]
 [(Tuple 0 4),(Tuple 0 5)]
```
declarations.title: zipE

declarations.comments: calculate the determinant for matrix.
declarations.title: det

declarations.comments:
Computes the multiplicative inverse of a regular matrix.
The function uses [Cramer's Rule](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cramer%27s_rule) for the computation.
declarations.title: inverse

declarations.comments:
```purescript
> 1 & 2 & 3 & empty
   [1, 2, 3]
```

```purescript
> unconsV $ matrix22 1 2 3 4
{ head: [1,2], tail: 
  [3,4] }
```
declarations.title: unconsV

declarations.comments:
```purescript
> unconsH $ matrix22 1 2 3 4
{ head: [1,3], tail: 
  [2]
  [4] }
```
declarations.title: unconsH

declarations.comments:
remove row at index. If index is out of bounds, there will be no change

```purescript
> m
 [1,2]
 [3,4]

> removeRow 0 m
 [2]
 [4]
```
declarations.title: removeRow

declarations.comments:
remove column at index. If index is out of bounds, there will be no change

```purescript
> m
  [1,2]
  [3,4]

> removeColumn 1 m
  [1,2]
```
declarations.title: removeColumn
